title: custom lettering based on very old document
content:
The URL here displays a custom restaurant sign based  
on an old municipal document, perhaps as much as 200  
years old. I wouldn't think there exists a font today  
to match, but is there any similar font that I might  
use for the restaurant's website?

I note the serifs on the lowercase l, v, a, and d,  
and the top serif on the uppercase C.

[http://clevelanderbar.googlepages.com/Clevelander1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045128/http:/clevelanderbar.googlepages.com/Clevelander1.jpg "http://clevelanderbar.googlepages.com/Clevelander1.jpg")

Thanks.

redstart
author: redstart

comments.content:
Are you looking for the Type ID forum by chance? It is at [http://typophile.com/forum/29](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417045128/http:/typophile.com/forum/29 "http://typophile.com/forum/29")

(If a host sees this, they might move it [and delete my message]). Otherwise you might want to repost there. Traffic in the education forum is quite light.
Thanks; I'll repost. My apologies: senior moment there. Mike
